description: From Middle English raysyn, borrowed from Anglo-Norman reysin (“grape, raisin”), from Late Latin racīmus, from Latin racēmus. Possibly a distant cognate of Persian رز‎ (raz, “vine”). Doublet of raceme.

verbs.description: raisin (third-person singular simple present raisins, present participle raisining, simple past and past participle raisined)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) Of grapes: to dry out; to become like raisins.
